name: St. Angela Merici

locations.description: Foundress of the Ursulines, the first teaching order of women in the Catholic Church, in Brescia

summary: Angela Merici was an Italian religious educator who founded the Company of St. Ursula (Ursulines) in 1535, the first teaching order of women in the Catholic Church. She dedicated her life to educating girls and young women, particularly the poor. The Ursulines became one of the largest and most influential teaching orders in the Church.
